Class MyEngine

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
MVC.simu.framework.Engine
MVC.simu.model.MyEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, IEngine
public class MyEngine extends Engine
The MyEngine class defines the main simulation logic for the visa application processing system.

It manages the flow of ApplicationAsCustomer objects through various ServicePoints according to the events defined in EventType. It tracks statistics such as total processed applications, approvals, rejections, average time in system, and detects the system bottleneck.

At the end of the simulation, MyEngine persists all results using SimulationRunDao and updates the GUI through the IControllerMtoV controller.

  • Constructor Details

    • MyEngine

      public MyEngine(IControllerMtoV controller, DistributionConfig[] configs, Long seed)
      Constructs a new simulation engine instance.
      Parameters:
      controller - the controller used to update the GUI
      configs - the distribution configurations for each service point and the arrival process
      seed - optional random seed (if null, a system time–based seed is used)

  • Method Details

    • initialization

      protected void initialization()
      Initializes the simulation by scheduling the first arrival event.
      Specified by:
      initialization in class Engine

    • runEvent

      protected void runEvent(Event t)
      Handles all event types that occur during the simulation run. This method defines how ApplicationAsCustomer objects move between service points and how outcomes (approval/rejection) are determined.
      Specified by:
      runEvent in class Engine
      Parameters:
      t - the event to process

    • tryCEvents

      protected void tryCEvents()
      Checks each ServicePoint for conditions that allow service to begin or a bottleneck to be detected. This is called repeatedly during the simulation loop.
      Overrides:
      tryCEvents in class Engine

    • results

      protected void results()
      Collects and persists the final simulation results at the end of each simulation run.

      This includes:

      • Computing overall statistics (approval rate, average time, exits)
      • Detecting the bottleneck service point
      • Persisting all entities (SimulationRun, SPResult, DistConfig, ApplicationLog) into the database
      • Building and displaying a summary report in the GUI
      Specified by:
      results in class Engine
